subject: p18855147
History: To rule out pneumothorax. Acute shortness of breath.
Findings: Mild pulmonary edema is present. Left lower lung opacity is likely a combination of small atelectasis and probably a small effusion. Right small pleural effusion is presumed. Heart size is mildly enlarged, and the pulmonary vasculature is minimally congested. A right central line tip ends at lower SVC.
Impression: Mild pulmonary edema. Left lower lung opacity is likely a combination of atelectasis and effusion and right lung base atelectasis is minimal. There is no evidence of pneumothorax.
